Boards & Committees
Boards and Committees appointed by City Council
Planning Board/Board of Adjustment/Design Review Board
9 members: Meets the 3rd Thursday of each month at 6:00 p.m.
Okeechobee Utility Authority Board of Directors
City Appoints 3 of the 8 members: Meets the 3rd Tuesday of each month at 8:30 a.m.
Municipal Police Officers’ and Firefighters' Pension Board of Trustees
5 members:
Meets the 1st Monday in Feb., May, Aug. & Nov. at 4:30 p.m.
General Employees’ Retirement System Board of Trustees
5 members:
Meets the 1st Monday in Feb., May, Aug. & Nov. at 5:30 p.m.
Project Specific Committees appointed by City Council
NO APPOINTED COMMITTEES AT THIS TIME
Volunteer to Help Your City – serve on a City Citizen Board!
​
All applicants for a City Board shall complete a Citizen Board/Committee Application form. Board members serve their appointed term without any compensation. Additional qualifications may be required depending on the particular board. Board members are appointed by the City Council, excluding those Pension Trustees who are elected by the Fund Members.
Citizen Board Handbook
Citizens Board Flyer
For board vacancies, please
click here
.
Technical Review Committee
The Technical Review Committee meets the 3rd Thursday of each month at 10:00 a.m.
The Technical Review Committee consists of the following representative from each listed department and/or organization:
City Administrator
Building Official
Public Works Maintenance Foreman
Police Chief
Okeechobee County Fire Rescue
Okeechobee County Health Department
Okeechobee Utility Authority
Okeechobee County School Board

Special Events
Speckled Perch
Click here
for more information
Music Festival
Click here
for more information
Parades
Currently the major parades within our city are:
Speckled Perch Parade, usually the second Saturday in March  to coincide with the Speckled Perch Festival
Christmas Parade, held in the evenings the second Saturday in December
Cattleman’s Parade, held on Labor Day each year
Homecoming Parade for Okeechobee High School, Thursday before Homecoming Game
Parade Permit
:
Though local roadways can be closed with the approval of the City Council, to close State roadways, approval must come from the Department of Transportation. State Roads include SR70 and US HWY 441. They require a closure request submitted to FDOT 45 days in advance of the closure.
Use of City Parks and temporary street closures require an application and approval by various departments.
Park Use and/or Temporary Street/Sidewalk Closing Form

City Council
The City of Okeechobee's City Council is made up of five representatives who reside within the city limits. They are elected at large, (not by districts), to four-year terms. Each even- numbered year on General Election Day in November, the city's registered voters may elect or re-elect two or three City Council members to represent them in their city government.
Group photo left to right:  Councilmember David McAuley, Vice Mayor Monica Clark, seated, Mayor Dowling R. Watford, Jr., Councilmember Noel Chandler, and Councilmember Bob Jarriel.
Dowling R. Watford Jr., Mayor
dwatford@cityofokeechobee.com
Term of office: Jan 6, 1987 to Jan 4, 2027

Administration
Mission Statement
To provide accommodating services that enhance the quality of life for our citizens and businesses in a fiscally sound manner.
Responsibilities
The City Administrator is responsible for:
Carrying out the directive and policies established by the City Council.
Ensuring all laws and acts of the City Council subject to enforcement by the Administrator are faithfully executed.
Preparing and submitting the annual budget, budget message, and capital outlay program, and supervise and administer all phases of the budgetary process.
Making such reports as the City Council may require concerning the operation of City departments, offices, and agencies and organize and oversee the operation of said departments, offices, and agencies.
Negotiating leases, contracts, and other agreements including consultant services for the City subject to approval of the City Council and see that all terms and conditions of the same are performed as required and notify the Council of any noted violation.
Providing leadership and direction to department employees for the safe and efficient cares of the City’s facilities, inventory, equipment and infrastructures.
Keeping the City Council fully advised as to the financial conditions and future needs of the City and to make such recommendations concerning the affairs and operation of the City.
Vision Statement
To maintain a vibrant and prosperous community built on our heritage, history, unique character and small-town atmosphere.
